content.description: From the belay ledge, traverse right underneath Double Helix to the next vertical crack. Hand-jam up the very sharp crystals to a slight rest below a protectable overhang. Pull out the left side with exhilarating moves for the grade to a bolted anchor. A single 70m rappel just reaches the ground, or rap to an intermediate anchor at Betty Boop or Dress.
content.location: Gain the belay ledge by climbing Betty Boop (5.8 sport), or climb Midnight Rambler (5.6 trad with moderate runout traverse right).

content.description: From belay ledge, step up to a layback crack, then up to a narrow ledge. Finish up face to the right, past a bolt to a bolted anchor. A single 70m rappel just reaches the ground, or rap to the intermediate anchor at Betty Boop.
content.location: Gain the belay ledge by climbing Betty Boop (5.8 sport), or climb Midnight Rambler (5.6 trad with moderate runout traverse right).

content.description: Layback crack up from belay anchor to ledge as for Double Helix - Right. Exit left for this more difficult finish to bolted anchor. A single 70m rappel just reaches the ground, or rap to the intermediate anchor at Betty Boop.
content.location: Gain the belay ledge by climbing Betty Boop (5.8 sport), or climb Midnight Rambler (5.6 trad with moderate runout traverse right).

content.description: From belay anchor, climb up the clean left-leaning dihedral to a bolted anchor.
content.location: 2nd pitch above Dress: hike down and right from Craig's Crack, through the basin, and back up hill about 100'. Climb Dress to gain the belay anchor.

content.description: Relatively short headwall above the right side of Main Face, home of several trad crack routes.
